name: DAO Union
background:
The DAO Union is a coalition of aliens equipped with advanced weapons and drones. Their armies rely on advanced ranged weaponry and mobility to keep enemies at bay.

Those in the DAOU have embraced logic as the core of their society, rejecting selfish impulses. They came to depend upon machine logic to make sensible and impartial choices, which earned them a reputation as mediators in Sirius. It was only when this logic nearly resulted in their total redundancy that they began to question it. Rejecting AI, those in the DAOU now seek to build a better society for themselves.
backgroundFull:
From its very foundation, DAO society required every role and member to co-operate in order to survive. Much thought was put into how best to divide both work and resources between the DAO people. As their society advanced, they embraced logic as a core tenet. The wisest DAO served as Sages, who divided the necessary work and resources as efficiently and logically as possible. Everyone in this society had a precise role to fill, and together they formed the DAO Union.

As technology progressed, the Sages created artificial intelligences in order to manage their society. Initially, these AIs were merely an expansion of their extensive bureaucracy, processing data with far greater efficiency than had previously been imagined possible. The Sages gradually expanded the AIs’ role, as they became convinced that AIs would be able to maximize efficiency without falling prey to the bias and error.

Under the guidance of these systems, the DAO expanded beyond their home system. As the scale of their society continued to grow, their AIs grew increasingly interconnected and complex. Many came to trust in the AI implicitly, as it came to organize in their lives everything from manufacturing to diplomacy.

The DAO avoided the worst of the Radiance Cascade due to their distance, but their AI began to act differently. Slowly, it began to deem a number of citizens “redundant”, assigning machines to their former roles. This caused social unrest as many DAO people found themselves suddenly without the jobs that once gave them purpose. 

This continued until the AI locked out the Sages, claiming their input was no longer required. This caused outrage throughout the DAOU, and many began to sabotage infrastructure to undermine the system. The AI was not ready for this spontaneous reaction and acted too late to save itself. After this, the Sages ruled AI should never be able to perform a DAO's role.

This conflict was highly destructive to DAO society. Many felt despondent at the loss of the AI which had once given their lives direction. Sages stepped up once more, salvaging what records and infrastructure they could to guide reconstruction. Most of those living in the DAOU find their purpose in their job and social role, which have been highly systematized. Yet some feel that they are just repeating the logic that nearly drove their people into obsolescence.

How will you bring direction to a disordered galaxy?

spells.name: Aura of Peace
spells.effect: Pick up to two friendly units within 12", which get Fearless once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Killing Blow
spells.effect: Pick one enemy model within 18", which takes 2 hits with AP(1).

spells.name: Psychic Stabilization
spells.effect: Pick up to four friendly units within 12", which get Targeting Visor Boost once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

costFormula.value: { name: params.effect.unitRule.name, rating: params.effect.unitRule.rating, multiplier: params.multiplier * (params.aura ? this.AuraSize : 1), avgUnit: !params.thisUnit }

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Deadly Surge
spells.effect: Pick up to two enemy units within 6", which take 3 hits with Bane each.

spells.name: Coordinated Aggression
spells.effect: Pick up to six enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets AP(1) when shooting against once (next time the effect would apply).

parameters.name: effectDuration
parameters.value: once (next time the effect would apply)

effectDuration.name: once (next time the effect would apply)

spells.name: Devastating Strike
spells.effect: Pick up to three enemy units within 12", which take 2 hits with Decimate each.

specialRules.name: Stealth Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Stealth. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Melee Shrouding Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Melee Shrouding. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Good Shot
specialRules.description: This model gets +1 to hit rolls when shooting.

specialRules.name: Shielded
specialRules.description: Units where all models have this rule get +1 to defense rolls against hits that are not from spells.

specialRules.name: Ranged Slayer Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Ranged Slayer. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Decimate
specialRules.description: Ignores Cover, and against units where most models have Defense 2+ to Defense 3+, this weapon gets AP(+2).

specialRules.name: Counter-Attack Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Counter-Attack. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Increased Shooting Range Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get +6" range when shooting. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Shred when Shooting
specialRules.description: This model gets Shred when shooting.

specialRules.name: Targeting Visor
specialRules.description: When this model shoots at enemies over 9" away, it gets +1 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Fortified Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Fortified. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Ignores Cover when Shooting
specialRules.description: This model gets Ignores Cover when shooting.

specialRules.name: Targeting Visor Boost Aura
specialRules.description: This model and up to 3 friendly units picked before the start of the game get Targeting Visor Boost. If this model is killed, picked models that are deployed lose the rule.

specialRules.name: Precision Spotter
specialRules.description: Once per activation, pick one enemy unit within 36" and in line of sight of this model and roll one die, on a 4+ place a marker on it. Friendly units may remove markers from their target before rolling to hit to get +X to hit rolls when attacking, where X is the number of removed markers.

specialRules.name: Ambush Beacon
specialRules.description: Friendly units using Ambush may ignore distance restrictions from enemies if they are deployed within 6" of this model.

specialRules.name: Piercing Shooting Mark
specialRules.description: Once per activation, before attacking, pick up to 4 enemy units within 18", which friendly units gets AP(+1) when shooting against once (next time the effect would apply).

specialRules.name: Stealth
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule are shot from over 9" away, enemy units get -1 to hit rolls.

specialRules.name: Melee Shrouding
specialRules.description: Enemies get -3" movement when trying to charge units where all models have this rule.

specialRules.name: Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.

specialRules.name: Ranged Slayer
specialRules.description: This model's ranged weapons get AP(+2) against units where most models have Tough(3) or higher.

specialRules.name: Ignores Cover
specialRules.description: This weapon ignores cover.

specialRules.name: AP
specialRules.description: Targets get -X to Defense rolls when blocking hits.

specialRules.name: Defense
specialRules.description: This model gets +X to defense rolls.

specialRules.name: Counter-Attack
specialRules.description: Strikes first when charged.

specialRules.name: Counter
specialRules.description: Strikes first with this weapon when charged, and the charging unit gets -1 total Impact rolls per model with Counter.

specialRules.name: Shred
specialRules.description: On unmodified results of 1 to block hits, this weapon deals 1 extra wound.

specialRules.name: Fortified
specialRules.description: When units where all models have this rule take hits, those hits count as having AP(-1), to a min. of AP(0).

specialRules.name: Targeting Visor Boost
specialRules.description: If this model has Targeting Visor, it always gets +1 to hit rolls when shooting from Targeting Visor (instead of only when shooting over 9" away).

specialRules.name: Ambush
specialRules.description: May be set aside before deployment. At the start of any round after the first, may be deployed anywhere over 9” away from enemy units. Players alternate in placing Ambush units, starting with the player that activates next. Units that deploy via Ambush can’t seize or contest objectives on the round they deploy.

specialRules.name: Fearless
specialRules.description: When a unit where all models have this rule fails a morale test, roll one die. On a 4+ it counts as passed instead.

specialRules.name: Bane
specialRules.description: Ignores Regeneration, and when attacking the target must re-roll unmodified Defense results of 6.
